Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: Based on the provided information, there are some general sustainable practices mentioned, like reducing carbon footprint by offsetting and monitoring, being mindful of energy consumption, and considering the environmental impact of operations. a sense of alignment and purpose   Dennis Relojo-Howell explained to Psychreg how our relationships extend beyond just people In addition we have relationships with things in our environments such as our beds our food and phones He summarised “When you make sustainable choices in a similar way to getting that dopamine kick from helping someone in need you get to feel good about the resources that you use and the choices that you make which in turn improves your mental health” When a Stress Matters wellbeing assessment is deployed company-wide it empowers you to delve deeper into any potential issues and areas for improvement around sustainability and mental health At Stress Matters we’ve recently achieved B Corp status That means we’re officially recognised for practising what we preach socially and environmentally It’s an area we’re ready and able to visit with you to take a closer look at the effects sustainability might be having on mental health in your business Reducing Workplace

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: Are there any events or initiatives focused on environmental conservation? If yet then list 10 such events.
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
As of my knowledge cutoff date in September, there were several notable events and initiatives focused on environmental conservation. However, providing a comprehensive list of 10 such events may not be feasible due to the rapidly evolving nature of these initiatives and the possibility of newer ones having emerged since then. Some prominent examples of events and initiatives related to environmental conservation include:

1. United Nations Climate Change Conferences (COP)
2. World Wildlife Fund (WWF) Earth Hour
3. Global Landscapes Forum
4. CleanUpTheWorld Weekend
5. Greenbuild International Conference and Expo
6. Our Ocean Conference
7. IUCN World Parks Congress
8. Bonn Challenge
9. UN Convention to Combat Desertification (UNCCD)
10. Ramsar Convention on Wetlands

Please note that this list is not exhaustive, and there may be many more events and initiatives dedicated to environmental conservation.

source.content: First published on Conference  Incentive Travel as part of the Stress Matters wellbeing supplement in March  Planning how to fit wellbeing as an agenda item at your event can be a painstaking task Where does it fit What topics are people interested in Who do they want to hear from How do you appeal to the interests and needs of all of your attendees The answer is simple you can’t So the easiest option when planning events is to view wellbeing not just as part of your event agenda but integrate it holistically into the whole event experience With an aim of creating a culture of wellbeing around your events that will have attendees returning again and again When I organised the Annual Exchange in Birmingham in  the event had a holistic wellbeing culture built around it and this involved everything from the communications to the menu planning the timings and the content streams to the networking elements So how do you go about that realistically Let us try and break it down for you with a

eventprofs are notoriously “yes-people” It’s what makes our events great our boss or client adds another whole area to your event we say yes can you do it for the same budget we say yes can you do it by eop tomorrow we say yes It pushes us to create better events and to never accept the minimum Yet we don’t often do it for our own careers and development One of the 10 steps of our Don’t Just Be approach is be Open to Opportunities Those little doors are open around us but we don’t often push on them to see what’s behind Last month we encouraged you to “What it is you really want” Well the challenge for this month is to start looking at what might already be in front of us to help us get there That old boss that asked you for coffee but you’ve been putting off that client that dropped a potential new event into conversation but you haven’t yet followed up on or even that organiser that asked you to speak on a panel but you said no as you don’t like public speaking Try saying yes This

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What environmental impact metrics are reported?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: The report mentions two main environmental impact metrics: carbon footprint and environmental management practices. Carbon footprint refers to the total amount of greenhouse gases (primarily CO2) emitted by a company or individual, often measured in metric tons per year. This includes direct emissions from operations, such as energy consumption, and indirect emissions from purchased goods and services. By monitoring and offsetting their carbon footprint, the company can better understand and manage its contribution to climate change. Additionally, they evaluate their overall environmental management practices, including their impact on air quality, water conservation, land preservation, and biodiversity. These practices help them identify opportunities for improvement and ensure they operate responsibly within their ecosystem.

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Has the organization made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, the organization has made public commitments to social and corporate responsibility. They have applied for B Corp™ status, which requires companies to meet high standards of social and environmental performance, transparency, and accountability. This process involves a deep dive into all aspects of their operations to ensure they are meeting these requirements. Additionally, the organization values community involvement and strives to positively impact both people and the planet through their actions.

source.content: Applying for B Corp™ status means leaving no stone unturned in terms of a company’s social and end environmental ecosystem It’s a challenging process that digs deeply At Stress Matters we couldn’t be prouder to be awarded B Corp™ status in March  proving beyond reasonable doubt that everything we do has people and the environment at heart It’s our goal to have a positive impact on people and the planet To this end we’ve reviewed every part of our operation to ensure we’re being as environmentally conscious as we can We couldn’t be more highly delighted to achieve B Corp certification It’s not and was never meant to be an easy process It’s a landmark representing the beginning of a journey not the end of one B Corp status is core to our value proposition It publicly demonstrates and recognises the commitments we’ve been making since we started the business It’s our solid foundation to keep building higher and stronger on Very engaging on some tough topics Really enjoyed the interaction

is based on three pillars Creating your Business Case around these pillars will ensure that you’re understanding the real issues investing in the right initiatives to address those issues and ensuring that you build in accountability to continually adapt your approach to the changing environment These pillars are Internal accountability can be tough to achieve which is why a lot of our clients ask us to be their wellbeing partners To find out more about how this could work for you arrange a coffee over a zoom call and we’ll talk you through it or help you identify another way you can include accountability into your business case Identify the BenefitsIf you’ve done the other four sections well the biggest benefits have already been clearly demonstrated This section is an opportunity for you to put the icing on the cake Finish off your business case by appealing to the human side of your decision makers and highlighting the specific positive benefits that your plan is going to have on

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: What community or social events have been organized to fulfill these commitments?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Based on the provided information, there isn't any specific mention of community or social events being organized to fulfill the mentioned commitments. However, we do know that Change Recruitment Group has successfully organized their Delegate WranglersFEST event on June 20th, which was well-attended and celebrated the group's members overcoming adversity during the pandemic. This event could be seen as a form of community building and social interaction among members.

Commerce & Products.question: What products, services, or technologies are available?
Commerce & Products.result:
The list provided earlier includes various products, services, and technologies related to workplace wellbeing, team development, and stress management. Some of them include:

1. Professional services (e.g., coaching, training)
2. Workplace wellbeing programmes (e.g., mental health support, mindfulness courses)
3. Team development tools (e.g., assessments, diagnostic tools)
4. Tracking solutions (for monitoring progress and return on investment)
5. Budget-friendly options for companies starting their wellbeing journey
6. Customized wellbeing strategies based on individual team needs
7. Accountability partnerships to maintain positive change and momentum

Commerce & Products.question: Are there any promotional events, expos, or sales for these offerings? If yes, list them.
Commerce & Products.result:
Yes, there are various promotional events, expos, and sales related to these offerings. Here's a list of some notable ones:

1. Working From Home Live - This is the UK's leading trade show dedicated to shaping the future of remote hybrid working. It brings together professionals from different sectors who want to learn more about remote work and network with like-minded individuals.
2. Event Supplier & Services Association (ESSA) Trade Show - As a trade body representing the very best suppliers of goods and services to the events industry, ESSA organizes an annual trade show where members can showcase their products and services to potential clients.
3. Unique Venues of Manchester Annual Exhibition - This exhibition features alternative and unusual venues in Manchester, providing an opportunity for event planners and suppliers to connect and explore new partnerships.
4. British Institute of Kitchen, Bedroom, Bathroom Installation (BIKBB) Conference - The BIKBB holds an annual conference that brings together professionals from the kitchen, bedroom, and bathroom installation industries. Attendees can participate in networking opportunities, educational sessions, and product demonstrations.
5. Smart Training Company Workshops and Webinars - The Smart Training Company offers regular workshops and webinars on topics relevant to the hospitality industry. These events provide a platform for learning and development, as well as networking among professionals.

Commerce & Products.question: What are the key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce?
Commerce & Products.result:
There are several key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce mentioned in the given text. Some of these include:

1. The Smart Training Company - A training company focused on hospitality, offering learning and development services for the KBB merchant and construction sales markets.
2. Executive search and talent attraction services for the KBB merchant and construction sales markets.
3. The British Institute Of Kitchen Bedroom & Bathroom Installation - A non-profit organization dedicated to KBB installation and education.
4. Event Supplier & Services Association (ESSA) - A trade body representing the very best suppliers of goods and services to the events industry.
5. The event and visual communication association - Celebrating and accelerating the success of Britain's creative industries.

Employment & Opportunities.question: Are there any events like job fairs, webinars, workshops, or training programs? If yes, list them.
Employment & Opportunities.result:
Yes, there are various events like job fairs, webinars, workshops, and training programs related to personal and professional growth. Here's a list of some notable events from different categories:

Job Fairs:

1. National Career Fair - A nationwide event held across multiple cities where companies come together to recruit potential candidates. Visit their website for more details on dates and locations.
2. Virtual Job Summit - An online job fair featuring virtual sessions, panel discussions, and networking opportunities. Check their website for updates on upcoming events.
3. Local job fairs organized by community organizations, colleges, and universities. Keep an eye on local newsletters, social media platforms, and event calendars for announcements.

Webinars:

1. LinkedIn Learning Webinars - Offering a range of topics covering personal development, technology, creativity, and business skills. Access their library through LinkedIn Premium membership.
2. Coursera Webinars - Providing free and paid webinars on various subjects such as data science, programming, digital marketing, and many more. Sign up for their newsletter to stay updated on upcoming webinars.
3. Skillshare Webinars - Offers affordable webinars on creative skills such as drawing, painting, photography, and crafting. You can also access their extensive class library for self-paced learning.

Workshops and Training Programs:

1. General Assembly (GA) - GA offers a diverse range of immersive workshops and courses in fields like web development, data analysis, product management, UX/UI design, and more. Find a location near you or explore their online options.
2. CreativeLive - Delivers live and on-demand workshops and classes in creative fields such as photography, music production, writing, and graphic design. Explore their course catalogue for upcoming events.
3. Mindvalley - A platform offering transformational workshops and courses focused on personal growth, entrepreneurship, health, and wellness. Browse their course library for future events.

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employee or participant benefits are highlighted?
Employment & Opportunities.result:
Based on the provided information, some key employee or participant benefits that are highlighted include:

1. Financial Security: Companies should focus on providing financial security for their employees through various means such as offering competitive salaries, bonuses, and pensions.
2. Health & Wellness Support: Ensuring employees maintain good physical and mental health is crucial. This includes promoting work-life balance, providing access to fitness facilities, and offering resources for managing stress and anxiety.
3. Career Development: Offering opportunities for professional growth and advancement helps employees feel engaged and satisfied in their roles.
4. Satisfaction & Engagement: By fostering a positive work environment and actively seeking feedback from employees, companies can ensure high levels of job satisfaction and employee engagement.

Financials & Funding.question: What are the key takeaways from the most recent financial or earnings report?
Financials & Funding.result: Based on the provided information, there isn't enough detail about specific financial metrics or earnings reports to provide a clear answer. However, some general insights can be gathered regarding the company's performance over the past 12 months. Despite facing challenges such as a "rollercoaster" financial situation and tough times for small business owners, the company has managed to achieve their governance goals by focusing on improving their internal processes rather than resting on their laurels. Additionally, they have shown dedication to supporting their employees through difficult times by providing pay raises and addressing immediate needs. Finally, while the company acknowledges the importance of community engagement and impact, they mention having only a few suppliers and not finding much need to expand their supplier base recently.

eventprofs are notoriously “yes-people” It’s what makes our events great our boss or client adds another whole area to your event we say yes can you do it for the same budget we say yes can you do it by eop tomorrow we say yes It pushes us to create better events and to never accept the minimum Yet we don’t often do it for our own careers and development One of the 10 steps of our Don’t Just Be approach is be Open to Opportunities Those little doors are open around us but we don’t often push on them to see what’s behind Last month we encouraged you to “What it is you really want” Well the challenge for this month is to start looking at what might already be in front of us to help us get there That old boss that asked you for coffee but you’ve been putting off that client that dropped a potential new event into conversation but you haven’t yet followed up on or even that organiser that asked you to speak on a panel but you said no as you don’t like public speaking Try saying yes This

eventprofs are notoriously “yes-people” It’s what makes our events great our boss or client adds another whole area to your event we say yes can you do it for the same budget we say yes can you do it by eop tomorrow we say yes It pushes us to create better events and to never accept the minimum Yet we don’t often do it for our own careers and development One of the 10 steps of our Don’t Just Be approach is be Open to Opportunities Those little doors are open around us but we don’t often push on them to see what’s behind Last month we encouraged you to “What it is you really want” Well the challenge for this month is to start looking at what might already be in front of us to help us get there That old boss that asked you for coffee but you’ve been putting off that client that dropped a potential new event into conversation but you haven’t yet followed up on or even that organiser that asked you to speak on a panel but you said no as you don’t like public speaking Try saying yes This

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result: Through collaboration, both parties aim to achieve shared goals and desired outcomes. These may include improved employee engagement, reduced absenteeism and staff turnover, increased productivity, enhanced company culture, and greater overall organizational success. Additionally, partnerships can lead to joint projects, knowledge sharing, and access to new resources, which further contribute to the achievement of mutual objectives and outcomes.

source.content: You’ll see this return purely through a reduction in absenteeism and staff turnover and an increase in productivity But there are other benefits too that are a little harder to quantify such as If you want to work through the numbers for your business case we’re always on hand to help out with this Just request a zoom call and we’ll talk you through it Identify The Best ApproachThere is no one best approach The best approach is the one that will get the best results for your business You’ll only know what this might be by understanding your insights first We very often throw money at a problem in the hope that it works Even if it doesn’t at least it looks like we’ve tried right We don’t think this is a sustainable approach or one that ensures the best results Our tried and tested approach is based on three pillars Creating your Business Case around these pillars will ensure that you’re understanding the real issues investing in the right initiatives to address those issues and
